result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] was dismissed by the court.

  • Michail David Buchite was found guilty of OWI (7th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes: Applied bond on file balance of $5928.00 fine to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF522.

$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF522.
$52.00 Blood Draw to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF522.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Mental Health Assessment and any recommended follow through.
-Maintain current treatment.
-Regular and random testing.
-Any additional programming as recommended by Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
AODA and Driver's Safety Plan, and follow any recommended treatment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Alex Stormont DF: Michail David Buchite appeared. Agent Natalie Volz appeared. Case called at 3:02. Court reviews file. Court reads charge and maximum penalty.There are no corrections to the PSI.  ADA Hartung updates the court and requests the DE clear up the outstanding Warrant in Florida as part of sentencing today. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:
8 years total confinement
3 years Initial, 5 years ES
Court notes 115 days credit

Conditions of ES:
- 36 mo drivers license revocation
- 36 mo. IID 
- $6428.00 fine inclusive of costs
 $52.00 for the blood draw.
   Apply bond on file any balance to be paid through DOC.
- AODA and driver's safety plan.and any recommended follow through
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
- Mental Health assessment and any recommended follow through and maintain current treatment. 
- Regular and random testing. 
- Any additional program as recommended by agent. 

DE is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 
DE is not eligible for the CIP program. 
Bond revoked DE remanded.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Alex Stormont DF: Michail David Buchite appeared. Case called at 3:52. Includes 14CF522, 15CF01, 15CF21. ADA Hartung updates the court. Atty. Stormont agrees. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1  in second amended information in 14CF522. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. DE acknowledges priors. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1  in second amended information OWI 7th  in 14CF522. On motion of the State without objection, Crt merges and dismisses Ct 2 in 14CF522 Court also dismisses 15CF01 and 15CF21. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: a PSI to be completed by 10-13-15. Court maintains bond. Materials from Dr. Henson to be sealed in the file.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
filed by ADA Matthew Hartung. eif

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF21, 14CF522 and 15CF1:
  Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Liddle. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  Alex Stormont   DF:  Michail David Buchite appeared. Case called at 11:45 a.m. Court notes on 15CF1 there has not been a preliminary hearing on that case. ADA Hartung states this case has a resolution. Amended information has been filed by the state reducing charge from 8th offense to 7th offense. Court reviews charges, rights and penalties. Defendant understands. Defendant pleads NG to all counts on the amended information. Atty Stormont waives further reading. Bond continues in form and amount on all files  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 03:30 pm.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on July 30, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley DF ATTY: Alex Stormont DF: Michail D. Buchite appeared by phone. Case called at 3:47. Set for FPT. Includes 14CF522, 15CF01, 15CF21. Court reviews file. ADA McKinley updates the court as to DE driving record. Atty. Stormont responds and requests more time for DE to finish treatment. Bond will be modified  to reflect the new treatment facility Kinnic Falls. If DE does not complete treatment he must report immediately to jail.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Jennifer Anne Bork DF ATTY: Alex Stormont DF: Michail David Buchite appeared by phone. Case called at 4:35.  Includes 14CF522, 15CF01 and 15CF21. Atty. Stormont updates the court, DE will be discharged on April 29,2015. It is a follow-up treatment facility. Atty. Stormont requests a STC prior to his release date. ADA Bork agrees there is a possible settlement after treatment is completed. DE can appear by phone for next hearing.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
Status conference on March 23, 2015 at 04:30 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  J. Bork. DF ATTY: Alex Stormont DF:  Michail D. Buchite appeared by phone.  Case called at 8:58. In 15CF21, court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG in 15CF21.  Waives speedy trial. DE does not know discharge date as of yet. If in treatment DE can call in. If out of treatment DE to report to jail.  Status conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 04:30 pm.

Arraignment on January 7, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

**BOND AMENDED**
 _X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $2500.00 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- Defendant must maintain residence with Mother in Glenwood City at the County Road G address unless participating in treatment. 

- Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex. 

- Report every Wednesday and Saturday before 5:00 pm to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY:  Alex Stormont, DF:  Michail D. Buchite appeared from jail. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. State files INFO and intends to file an amended INFO after receipt of results. Atty Stormont requests bond amendment.  Arraignment scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
